name: Transparent Tooltips - Global - Firefox 3 (WOW)
description:
Gives you Transparency on all Tooltips (Global style).
** Must be installed along with Style 8555 for this style to work!! **

* Thanks to for introducing me into the realm of Transparency with style 4120

You can Customize the amount of transparency by editing the Opacity in the code (Closer to 0 is closer to invisible, whereas closer to 1 is closer to fully-visible - EXAMPLE: 0.5 is in the middle of opacity)

This makes your tooltips look really cool.
This style supports only Firefox3, giving it even more of a WOW effect!.

Applies to:
+ Navigation Toolbar (Hover over button)
+ Hovering on a tab (tooltip will have radius)
+ Also Applies to EVERY single item on any web page (Hover over a link)

Additional Information:
+ This style has been tested on Multiple Themes! Including NASA Night Launch, NASA Normal, and the Default Firefox 3 Theme.  It has rounded perfectly on each.
Feel free to customize the transparency level (described above) ... no reposting mods though!
* You will probably have to Restart your browser for this style's functionality to work completely.
** Must be installed along with Style 8555 for this style to work!! **

Browser Versions:
+ Works only on Firefox3

Integrates with the following Styles:
+ Style 8555
** Must be installed along with Style 8555 for this style to work!! **
+ Style 8818
+ Style 8558

Works well with:
+ All of the Glasser / Transparent styles
+ The Styles Displayed above

Changelog:
1.0.0.1
+ Updated code to work on Firefox 3.1 (Shiretoko) - No longer uses -moz-opacity, it is now just opacity.

|   Last Updated:  |  November 27, 2008                                 |

#btTooltip,
#un-toolbar-tooltip,
#tooltip,
.tooltip,
#aHTMLTooltip,
#urlTooltip,
tooltip
{
  opacity: 0.7 !important;
  -moz-appearance: none !important;
}
